page.title: 09Aberdeen Airport
page.content: {Aberdeen Airport,}formerly known as Dyce Airport, has served the City of Aberdeen since the 1930's. In those early days of aviation it was a simple grass field. During World War II it was upgraded to a Fighter Airfield by the R.A.F. and today it is one of the busiest Airports in the U.K. in relation to the number of flights and is the busiest heliport in the world. For example in{1965/66}about{90,000} passengers used the airfield, by{1985} the figure was nearer{2 million.} Aircraft movements during this period had grown to a staggering figure of about{9000 aircraft {movements a month.}
